alert.note: Alert for Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Greenup and western Carter Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rome to Bangor. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Gesling, Carter, Grahn, Soldier, Globe and Brushart. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
